1111652971488657409.text: - In another episode of learning from real-world, legacy, best practice project management, @hudsonjameson will begin recording and posting outstanding tasks & to do items for each call. Very amaze! Much accountabilityness! This has been working well for @EthCatHerders.

1111652959400665089.text:
Today's #AllCoreDevs call was one of the most productive, efficient ever! Well done squad . Here are my subjective takeaways:

- We have a handful of interesting EIPs already proposed for Istanbul, with a hard deadline of May 17 for new proposals: https://en.ethereum.wiki/roadmap/istanbul …

1111640240979091459.text: Second, audit update. @EthCatHerders are continuing to fundraise for the audit. The Gitcoin link is here: https://gitcoin.co/grants/82/official-progpow-technical-audit-funding … and @hudsonjameson is also doing some fundraising.

1111633152521523200.text: Talking about EIP1, there is a lot that needs to be improved: How do we define when things get rejected? How can we better separate ERC vs. EIPs? @EthCatHerders have already started some work on this, see here:https://github.com/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/issues/19 …

Some folks think Ethereum is useless. I'd like to respond with a story.

A few months ago, some good people decided to band together in a completely grassroots fashion to help out with project management. Thus, the @EthCatHerders initiative was born: https://medium.com/ethereum-cat-herders/further-introduction-the-ethereum-cat-herders-c42bf026fb7c … (1/7)

1091358335960535040.text:
ProgPoW update:
1. Community is forming a 3rd party audit.
2. Miners should start vote signalling using extraData field.
3. @EthCatHerders are going to investigate other ways to help parse community sentiment and help find a way to make a decision.

1091338552015814656.text: ATTENTION: All nodes on Ropsten, Kovan, Rinkeby, and Ethereum need to be upgraded to Geth 1.8.22 or Parity 2.2.8/2.3. These upgrades are re-enabling Constantinople on mainnet and also downgrading Ropsten back into alignment.

1093202321310404616.text:
We are keen to gauge a rough consensus from the community on ProgPoW and as such will be asking some questions over the next week or so to get some additional data. To kick things off...

Do you think ProgPoW should be implemented? Please reply below to give additional details.

1093167837059956736.text:
We just concluded the first ProgPoW Audit/Review meeting. Immediate action items: 
1.  Identify and compile list of potential auditors
2.  Engage with relevant stakeholders (If you feel you have something to contribute, please reach out)

We hope to have a status update tomorrow!
